intro: Thoa africana, commonly known as African thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and milky sap. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. Thoa africana is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
